2.t: These are the verses of the illustrious Book.

3.t: You will perhaps kill yourself with anguish because they are not accepting the faith.
3.tr: La'allaka baakhi'un nafsaka allaa yakoonoo mu'mineen

4.t: Had We wanted, We would have sent them a miracle from the sky to make their heads hang down in submission.
4.tr: In nashaa nunazzil 'alaihim minas samaaa'i Aayatan fazallat a'naaquhum lahaa khaadi'een

5.t: Whenever a new message comes to them from the Beneficent God, they turn away from it.
5.tr: Wa-maa yaateehim min zikrim minar Rahmaani muhdasin illaa kaanoo 'anhu mu'rideen

6.t: They have called (our revelation) lies. They will soon learn the consequences of what they mocked.
6.tr: Faqad kazzaboo fasa-yaateehim ambaaa'u maa kaanoo bihee yastahzi'oon

7.t: Have they not seen the earth in which We have made gracious plants grow?
7.tr: Awa-lam yaraw ilal ardi kam ambatnaa feehaa min kulli zawjin kareem

8.t: In this there is, certainly, evidence (of the Truth). But most of them have no faith.
8.tr: Inna fee zaalika la-Aayah; Wa-maa kaana aksaruhum mu'mineen

9.t: Your Lord is the Majestic and the All-merciful.

10.t: When Your Lord told Moses to go to the unjust people of the Pharaoh
10.tr: Wa-iz naadaa Rabbuka Moosaaa ani' til qawmaz zaalimeen

11.t: and ask them, "Why do you not fear God?"

12.t: He replied, "Lord, I am afraid that they will call me a liar.
12.tr: Qaala Rabbi inneee akhaafu ai yukazziboon

13.t: I feel nervous and my tongue is not fluent, so send Aaron with me.
13.tr: Wa-yadeequ sadree Wa-laa yantaliqu lisaanee fa-arsil ilaa Haaroon

14.t: They have charged me [with a crime] for which I am afraid they will kill me."

15.t: The Lord said, "Have no fear, both of you go with Our miracles. We shall closely listen to you."
15.tr: Qaala kallaa fazhabaa bi-Aayaatinaaa innaa ma'akum mustami'oon

16.t: They came to the Pharaoh and said, "We are the Messengerss of the Lord of the Universe.
16.tr: Faatiyaa Fir'awna faqoolaaa innaa Rasoolu Rabbil 'aalameen

18.t: The Pharaoh said, "Did we not bring you up in our home as an infant and did you not live with us for many years
18.tr: Qaala alam nurabbika feenaa waleedanw Wa-labista feenaa min 'umurika sineen

19.t: and you did the deed which you did. You are certainly ungrateful."
19.tr: Wa-fa'alta fa'latakal latee fa'alta Wa-anta minal kaafireen

20.t: Moses said, "I did do it and I made a mistake.
20.tr: Qaala fa'altuhaaa izanw Wa-ana minad daaaleen

21.t: Then I ran away from you in fear, but my Lord granted me the law and has appointed me as a Messenger.
21.tr: Fafarartu minkum lam-maa khiftukum fawahaba lee Rabbee hukmanw Wa-ja'alanee minal mursaleen

22.t: And this is the favor with which you oblige me: You have made the Israelites your slaves.
22.tr: Wa-tilka ni'matun tamun-nuhaa 'alaiya an 'abbatta Baneee Israaa'eel

23.t: The Pharaoh asked, "Who is the Lord of the Universe?"

24.t: Moses replied, "The Lord of the heavens and the earth and all that is between them, if you want to be certain".
24.tr: Qaala Rabbus samaawaati wal-ardi Wa-maa bainahumaa in kuntum mooqineen

25.t: The Pharaoh said to the people around him, "Did you hear that?"

26.t: Moses continued, "He is the Lord and the Lord of your forefathers."

27.t: The Pharaoh said, "The Messengers who has been sent to you is certainly insane".
27.tr: Qaala inna Rasoolakumul lazee ursila ilaikum lamajnoon

28.t: Moses continued, "He is the Lord of the East and West and all that is between them, if only you would think".
28.tr: Qaala Rabbul mashriqi wal-maghribi Wa-maa baina-humaa in kuntum ta'qiloon

29.t: Pharaoh said, "If you put forward any god other than me, I will surely put you in prison".
29.tr: Qaala la'init takhazta ilaahan ghairee la-aj'alannaka minal masjooneen

30.t: Moses asked, "What if I were to bring you clear proof (of the existence of God)?"

31.t: The Pharaoh replied, "Bring it, if you are telling the truth."
31.tr: Qaala faati biheee in kunta minas saadiqeen

32.t: Moses threw his staff and suddenly it became a serpent.

33.t: Then he uncovered his hand and it was sheer white to the onlookers.
33.tr: Wa-naza'a yadahoo faizaa hiya baidaaa'u linnaa-zireen

34.t: The Pharaoh said to the people around him, "He is certainly a skillful magician.
34.tr: Qaala lilmala-i hawlahooo inna haazaa lasaahirun 'aleem

35.t: He wants to expel you from your land through his magic. What is your opinion?"
35.tr: Yureedu aien yukhrijakum min ardikum bisihrihee famaazaa taamuroon

36.t: They said, "Hold him and his brother off for a while
36.tr: Qaalooo arjih Wa-akhaahu wab'as fil madaaa'ini haashireen

37.t: and summon every skillful magician from all the cities."

38.t: So all the magicians gathered together

40.t: and the people were asked, "Will you all be there so that we may follow the magicians if they become victorious?"
40.tr: La'allanaa nattabi'us saharata in kaanoo humul ghaalibeen

41.t: When the magicians came, they asked the Pharaoh, "Will there be any reward for us if we win?"
41.tr: Falammaa jaaa'as saharatu qaaloo li-Fir'awna a'inna lanaa la-ajjran in kunnaa nahnul ghaalibeen

42.t: He replied, "You will then be my closest associates".
42.tr: Qaala na'am Wa-innakum izal laminal muqarrabeen

43.t: (Moses) asked the magicians, "Cast down what you want to".
43.tr: Qaala lahum Moosaaa alqoo maaa antum mulqoon

44.t: So they cast down their ropes and staffs saying, "By the honor of the Pharaoh we shall certainly become the winners".
44.tr: Fa-alqaw hibaalahum Wa-'isiyyahum Wa-qaaloo bi'izzati Fir'awna innaa lanahnul ghaaliboon

45.t: Then Moses cast down his staff and suddenly it swallowed up what they had falsely invented.
45.tr: Fa-alqaa Moosaa 'asaahu fa-izaa hiya talqafu maa yaafikoon

46.t: The magicians fell down in adoration

47.t: saying, "We believe in the Lord of the Universe

48.t: and the Lord of Moses and Aaron."

49.t: The Pharaoh said, "You believed without my permission? He seems to be your chief who has taught you magic. But you will soon know (the result of what you have done).
49.tr: Qaala aamantum lahoo qabla an aazana lakum innahoo lakabeerukumul lazee 'alla-makumus sihra falasawfa ta'lamoon; la-uqatti'anna aidiyakum Wa-arjulakum min khilaafinw Wa-la-usallibanna-kum ajma'een

50.t: I shall certainly cut off your hands and feet on opposite sides and crucify you all together."
50.tr: Qaaloo la daira innaaa ilaa Rabbinaa munqalliboon

51.t: They said, "It does not matter. We shall be returning to our Lord.
51.tr: Innaa natma'u aien yaghfira lanaa Rabbunna khataa-yaanaaa an kunnaaa awwalal mu'mineen

52.t: We hope that our Lord will forgive us for our sins; we were not believers at first."
52.tr: Wa-awhainaaa ilaa Moosaaa an asri bi'ibaadeee innakum muttaba'oon

53.t: We sent a revelation to Moses telling him to leave with our servants during the night; they would be pursued (by the Pharaoh).

54.t: The Pharaoh sent word to all the cities saying,

55.t: "There is a small group of people

57.t: We are warning all of you about them."

58.t: We deprived them (the unbelievers) of gardens, springs,

60.t: Thus we let the Israelites inherit them all.

61.t: The people of the Pharaoh pursued them at sunrise.
61.tr: Falammaa taraaa'al jam'aani qaala as-haabu Moosaaa innaa lamudrakoon

62.t: When the two groups came close to each other, the companions of Moses said, "We will be caught".
62.tr: Qaala kallaaa inna ma'iya Rabbee sa-yahdeen

63.t: Moses said, "Certainly not. My Lord is with me and He will certainly guide me."
63.tr: Fa-awhainaaa ilaa Moosaaa anid rib bi'asaakal bahra fanfalaqa fakaana kullu firqin kattawdil 'azeem

64.t: We sent a revelation to Moses saying, "Strike the sea with your staff." The sea was rent asunder and each side stood high up like a huge mountain.

65.t: Then We brought the two parties closer.

66.t: We saved Moses and all the people with him

67.tr: Inna fee zaalika la-Aayaah; Wa-maa kaana aksaru-hu mu'mineen

68.t: In this there was certainly evidence (of the Truth), but most of them did not have any faith.

69.t: Your Lord is certainly Majestic and All-merciful.

70.t: Tell them the story of Abraham,
70.tr: Iz qaala li-abeehi Wa-qawmihee maa ta'budoon

71.t: when he asked his father and others, "What do you worship?"

72.t: They replied, "We worship idols and shall continue to worship them".

73.t: He asked them, "Can the idols hear you when you pray to them

74.t: or can they benefit or harm you?"
74.tr: Qaaloo bal wajadnaaa aabaaa-'anaa kazaalika yaf'aloon

75.t: They said, "No, but our fathers worshipped them."

76.t: (Abraham) said, "Do you know that what you worship and what your grandfathers worshipped

77.t: are my enemies? Not so the Lord of the Universe.

78.t: He created me and He will guide me.

79.t: It is He who gives me food and drink

80.t: and heals me when I am sick.

81.t: He will cause me to die and will bring me back to life.

82.t: It is He whom I expect to forgive my sins on the Day of Judgment.
82.tr: Wallazeee atma'u aien yaghfira lee khateee'-atee Yawmad Deen

83.t: Lord, grant me authority. Join me to the righteous ones.
83.tr: Rabbi hab lee hukmanw Wa-alhiqnee bis-saaliheen

84.t: Make my words come true in the future.
84.tr: Waj'al lee lisaana sidqin fil aakhireen

85.t: Make me inherit the bountiful Paradise.

86.t: Forgive my father. He has gone astray.
86.tr: Waghfir li-abeee innahoo kaana mind daalleen

88.t: on the Day of Judgment when neither wealth nor children will be of any benefit
88.tr: Yawma laa yanfa'u maalunw Wa-laa banoon

89.t: except what is done in obedience to God with a submissive heart.
89.tr: Illaa man atal laaha biqalbin saleem

90.t: On the Day of Judgment Paradise will be brought near

91.t: the pious and hell will be left open for the rebellious ones

92.t: who will be asked, "What did you worship
92.tr: Wa-qeela lahum aina maa kuntum ta'budoon

93.t: besides God? Will the idols help you? Can they help themselves?"
93.tr: Min doonil laahi hal yansuroonakum aw yantasiroon

94.t: The idol worshippers, the idols, the rebellious ones,

95.t: and the army of satan will all be thrown headlong into hell.

97.t: they will say, "By God, we were in clear error
97.tr: Tallaahi in kunnaa lafee dalaalim mubeen

98.t: when we considered you equal to the Lord of the Universe.

99.t: Only the sinful ones made us go astray.

100.t: We have no one to intercede for us before God

102.t: Would that we could have a chance to live again so that we might become believers."
102.tr: Falaw anna lanaa karratan fanakoona minal mu'mineen

103.t: In this there is evidence (of the truth), but many of them do not have any faith.
103.tr: Inna fee zaalika la-Aayatanw Wa-maa kaana aksaruhum mu'mineen

104.t: Your Lord is certainly Majestic and All-merciful.

105.t: The people of Noah rejected the Messengerss.

106.t: Their brother Noah asked them, "Why do you not fear God?
106.tr: Iz qaala lahum akhoohum Noohun alaa tattaqoon

107.t: I am a trustworthy Messengers sent to you.

108.t: Have fear of God and obey me.

109.t: I ask no payment from you for my preaching. The Lord of the Universe will give me my reward.
109.tr: Wa-maaa as'alukum 'alaihi min ajrin in ajriya illaa 'alaa Rabbil 'aalameen

110.t: Have fear of God and obey me."

111.t: They said, "Should we believe in you when no one has followed you except the lowest ones".

112.t: (Noah) said, "I have no knowledge of their deeds.

113.t: If only you would realize, their account is with my Lord.
113.tr: In hisaabuhum illaa 'alaa Rabbee law tash'uroon

114.t: I do not drive away the believers.

116.t: They said, "Noah, if you do not desist, you will, certainly, be stoned to death."
116.tr: Qaaloo la'il lam tantahi yaa-Noohu latakoonanna minal marjoomeen

117.t: Then Noah said, "Lord, my people have rejected me.

118.t: Judge among us and save me and the believers with me".
118.tr: Faftab bainee Wa-bai-nahum fat-hanw Wa-najjinee Wa-mam ma'iya minal mu'mineen

119.t: We saved him and those who were with him in a fully laden Ark,
119.tr: Fa-anjainaahu Wa-mam ma'ahoo fil fulkil mashhoon

121.t: In this there is evidence (of the truth) but most of them do not have any faith.
121.tr: Inna fee zaalika la-Aayaah; Wa-maa kaana aksaruhum mu'mineen

122.t: Your Lord is Majestic and All-merciful.

123.t: The tribe of Ad rejected the Messengers.

124.t: Their brother Hud asked them, "Why do you not have fear of God?
124.tr: Iz qaala lahum akhoohum Hoodun alaa tattaqoon

125.t: I am a trustworthy Messengers sent to you.

126.t: Have fear of God and obey me.

127.t: I do not ask for any payment for my preaching. I shall receive my reward from the Lord of the Universe.
127.tr: Wa-maa as'alukum 'alaihi min ajrin in ajriya illaa 'alaa Rabbil 'aalameen

128.t: "Do you build useless monuments on every mountain

129.t: and raise strong mansions as if you were to live forever?

130.t: When you attack, you attack as tyrants do.

131.t: Have fear of God and obey me.

132.t: Have fear of the One who has bestowed upon you all that you know.

133.t: He has given you cattle, children,

135.t: I am afraid that you will suffer the torment of the Day of Judgment."

136.t: They said, "Whether you preach to us or not,
136.tr: Qaaloo sawaaa'un 'alainaaa awa-'azta am lam takum minal waa'izeen

137.t: your preaching is nothing but ancient legends and we shall not face any torment".

138.t: They rejected him and We destroyed them.

139.t: In this there is evidence (of the Truth), yet most of them do not have any faith.
139.tr: Fakazzaboohu fa-ahlaknaahum; inna fee zaalika la-aayah; Wa-maa kaana aksaruhum mu'mineen

140.t: Your Lord is Majestic and All-merciful.

141.t: The tribe of Thamud rejected the Messengers.

142.t: Their brother Salih asked them, "Why do you not fear God?
142.tr: Iz qaala lahum akhoohum Saalihun alaa tattaqoon

143.t: I am a trustworthy Messengers sent to you.

144.t: Have fear of God and obey me.

145.t: I do not ask for any payment for my preaching. I shall receive my reward from the Lord of the Universe.
145.tr: Wa-maaa as'alukum 'alaihi min ajrin in ajriya illaa 'alaa Rabbil 'aalameen

146.t: "Do you think that you will remain here peacefully forever

148.t: farms, and palm-trees in thick groves,

149.t: carving comfortable houses out of the mountains?

150.t: Have fear of God and obey me.

151.t: Do not obey the orders of the transgressors

152.t: who spread evil in the land with no reform."
152.tr: Allazeena yufsidoona fil ardi Wa-laa yuslihoon

153.t: They said, "You are only bewitched and insane.

154.t: You are a mere mortal like us. Show us a miracle if you are telling the Truth".
154.tr: Maaa anta illaa basharum mislunaa faati bi-Aayatin in kunta minas saadiqeen

155.t: He said, "This is a she-camel. She will have her share of water as you have your share, each on a certain day.
155.tr: Qaala haazihee naaqatul lahaa shirbunw walakum shirbu yawmim ma'loom

156.t: Do not cause her to suffer lest you become subject to the torment of the great day (of Judgment)."

157.t: They slew the she-camel, but later became regretful

158.t: and torment struck them. In this there is evidence of the Truth, yet many people do not have any faith.
158.tr: Fa-akhazahumul 'azaab; inna fee zaalika la-Aayah; Wa-maa kaana aksaruhum mu'mineen

159.t: Your Lord is Majestic and All-merciful.

160.t: The people of Lot rejected the Messengers.

161.t: Their brother Lot asked them, "Why do you not have fear of God?
161.tr: Iz qaala lahum akhoohum Lootun alaa tattaqoon

163.t: Have fear of God and obey me.

164.t: I do not ask any payment for my preaching. I shall receive my reward from the Lord of the Universe.
164.tr: Wa-maaa as'alukum 'alaihi min ajrin in ajriya illaa 'alaa Rabbil 'aalameen

165.t: Do you, in the world, want to have carnal relations with males

166.t: instead of your wives, whom your Lord has created specially for you? You are a transgressing people."
166.tr: Wa-tazaroona maa khalaqa lakum Rabbukum min azwaajikum; bal antum qawmun 'aadoon

167.t: They said, "Lot, if you do not give up preaching, you will certainly be expelled (from this town)".
167.tr: Qaloo la'il lam tantahi yaa-Lootu latakoonanna minal mukhrajeen

168.t: He said, "I certainly hate what you practice.

169.t: Lord, save me and my family from their deeds."

170.t: We saved him and all of his family

171.t: except an old woman who remained behind.

173.t: by pouring upon them a terrible shower of rain. How evil was the rain for those who had been warned!

174.t: In this there is an evidence of the Truth, but many of them did not have any faith.
174.tr: Inna fee zaalika la-Aayah; Wa-maa kaana aksaruhum mu'mineen

175.t: Your Lord is Majestic and All-merciful.

176.t: The dwellers of the forest also rejected the Messengers.

177.t: Shu'ayb asked them, "Why do you not have fear of God?
177.tr: Iz qaala lahum Shu'aybun alaa tattaqoon

179.t: Have fear of God and obey me.

180.t: I do not ask any payment for my preaching. I shall receive my reward from the Lord of the Universe.
180.tr: Wa-maaa as'alukum 'alaihi min ajrin in ajriya illaa 'alaa Rabbil 'aalameen

181.t: "Maintain just measure in your business and do not cause loss to others.
181.tr: Awful kaila Wa-laa takoonoo minal mukhsireen

182.t: Weigh your goods with proper balance

183.t: and do not defraud people in their property or spread evil in the land.
183.tr: Wa-laa tabkhasun naasa ashyaaa-'ahum Wa-laa ta'saw fil ardi mufsideen

184.t: Have fear of the One who has created you and the generations that lived before you."

185.t: They said, "You are no more than a bewitched and insane man

186.t: and a mere mortal like us. We think you are a liar.
186.tr: Wa-maaa anta illaa basharum mislunaa Wa-in nazunnuka laminal kaazibeen

187.t: Let a part of the sky fall on us if what you say is true".
187.tr: Fa-asqit 'alainaa kisafam minas samaaa'i in kunta minas saadiqeen

188.t: He said, "My Lord knows all that you do."

189.t: They rejected him and then the torment of the gloomy day struck them. It was certainly a great torment.
189.tr: Fakazzaboohu fa-akhazahum 'azaabu Yawmiz zullah; innahoo kaana 'azaaba Yawmin 'Azeem

190.t: In this there is an evidence of the Truth, but many of them did not have any faith.
190.tr: Inna fee zaalika la-Aayah; Wa-maa kaana aksaruhum mu'mineen

191.t: Your Lord is Majestic and All-merciful.

192.t: This, (Quran), is certainly the revelation from the Lord of the Universe.

193.t: It has been revealed through the trustworthy Spirit

194.t: to your heart, so that you will warn (the people of the dangers of disobeying God).

195.t: It has been revealed in plain Arabic.

196.t: Its news was also mentioned in the ancient Books.

197.t: Is not the fact (that the Israelite scholars already knew about the Quran through their Book) sufficient evidence for the pagans of the truthfulness (of the Quran)?
197.tr: Awalam yakul lahum Aayatan ai ya'lamahoo 'ulamaaa'u Baneee Israaa'eel

198.t: Had We revealed it to a non-Arab

199.t: who would have read it to them, they (pagans) would not have believed in it.

200.t: Thus it passes through the hearts of the criminals.

201.t: They will not believe in it until they suffer the painful torment.
201.tr: Laa yu'minoona bihee hattaa yarawul 'azaabal aleem

202.t: The torment will strike them suddenly without their knowledge.

203.t: They will say, "Can we be granted any respite?"

204.t: Do they want to hasten Our torment?

205.t: Do you not see that even if We give them respite for years

206.t: and then Our torment will strike them,

207.t: none of their luxuries will be able to save them from the torment?

208.t: We never destroyed any town without first sending to them warning and guidance.
208.tr: Wa-maaa ahlaknaa min qaryatin illaa lahaa munziroon

209.t: We have never been unjust to anyone.

210.t: The satans have not revealed the Quran;

211.t: they are not supposed to do so. Nor do have they the ability for such a task.

212.t: The satans are barred from listening to anything from the heavens.

213.t: (Muhammad), do not worship anything besides God lest you suffer the punishment.
213.tr: Falaa tad'u ma'al laahi ilaahan aakhara fatakoona minal mu'azzabeen

215.t: and be kind to your believing followers.
215.tr: Wakhfid janaahaka limanit taba-'aka minal mu'mineen

216.t: If they disobey you, tell them, "I condemn your disobedient deeds".
216.tr: Fa-in asawka faqul innee bareee'um mimmmaa ta'maloon

217.t: Have trust in the Majestic and All-merciful God,

218.t: who can see whether you stand up

219.t: or move during your prostration with the worshippers.

221.t: Should I tell you to whom the satans come?

222.t: They come to every sinful liar.

223.t: The satans try to listen to the heavens but many of them are liars.

224.t: Only the erring people follow the poets.

225.t: Have you not seen them wandering and bewildered in every valley
225.tr: Alam tara annahum fee kulli waadiny yaheemoon

226.t: and preaching what they themselves never practice.

227.t: The righteously striving believers among them who remember God very often and use their talent to seek help after they have been wronged are the exceptional. The unjust will soon know how terrible their end will be.
227.tr: Illal lazeena aamanoo Wa-'amilus saalihaati Wa-zakarul laaha kaseeranw wantasaroo min ba'di maa zulimoo; Wa-saya'lamul lazeena zalamooo aiya munqalabiny yanqaliboon
